Sentencas: For the first time, anodes and cathodes composed of La0.3Sr0.7Fe1-xCrxO3-delta (LSFC, x = 0-0.3) are used within a symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell (SSOFC).
Titulo: Sr-rich chromium ferrites as symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Titulo: Sr-rich chromium ferrites as symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell electrodes
Sr-rich chromium ferrites as symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: Although LSFC is robust under typical SSOFC conditions at 500 degrees C, in-situ X-ray diffraction studies at 800 degrees C in reducing atmospheres show that its perovkite structure can undergo a slow, pO(2)-dependent structural change, forming a LaSrFeO4-based Ruddlesden-Popper phase plus alpha-Fe, a process which can be reversed in air at 800 degrees C. For LSFC-3, this phase change occurs when the pO(2) of the fuel is lower than 1.9 x 10(-21) atm.
Titulo: Sr-rich chromium ferrites as symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: 30% for LSFC-3-based SSOFCs when using wet H-2, but the new anode composition still maintains a promising 0.2 W cm(-2) cell power density over several hundred hours of operation.
Titulo: Sr-rich chromium ferrites as symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: Extended full cell tests also show that the LSFC-3 anode performs very well in wet 1:1 H-2:CO fuels (pO(2) > 1.9 x 10(-21) atm) that contain 10 ppm H2S, demonstrating the excellent versatility of this electrode material.
Titulo: Sr-rich chromium ferrites as symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell electrodes
